intro: Lindsaea seemannii var. serrigera, commonly known as the serrated lindsaea, is a species of epiphytic fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, which help retain moisture. This variety is distinguished by its serrated leaf margins, giving it its common name.
